newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 25. [corrected 13:53 gmt]
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 25. [corrected 13:53 gmt]

text.p: * Aetna Inc reported third quarter earnings excluding charges of $0.95 per share compared to $0.97 a year ago. It reported third quarter net earnings per share of $0.77 per share against $1.86 in the 1995 quarter.
First Call mean estimate, which excludes the charges, was $0.95 per share. Shares closed at 60-1/8 Thursday.
(Corrects to add the line referring to Aetna earnings per share excluding charges and clarifies that the First Call estimate for the quarter also excludes charges)
* Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co is expected to report third quarter earnings of $0.93 per share, compared to $0.82 a year ago, according to First Call. Shares closed at 71-1/4.
* USX-U.S. Steel Group is expected to report third quarter earnings of $0.67 per share, compared to $0.95 a year ago, according to First Call. Shares closed at 27-1/4.
* USAir Group Inc said it decided to end its code-sharing agreement with British Airways Plc. USAir closed at 17-7/8 and U.S.-listed British Airways ADRs closed at 91-3/4.
* Chiron Corp reported a third quarter profit of $0.07 per share, compared to a loss of $0.90 after charges a year ago. Shares closed at 19-1/4.
* Borland International Inc reported a second quarter loss of $0.31 per share. Last week the company pre-announced a loss of $0.32-$0.36 per share. Shares closed at 4-7/8.
* Ben & Jerry's Homemade Inc reported third quarter earnings of $0.25 per share, down from $0.35 a year ago. Shares closed at 12-3/8.
